$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: The Family Empowerment Scholarship (FES) Program was established during the 2019 Legislative Session to enhance Florida's menu of education options. It will provide children whose families have limited financial resources with the opportunity to attend the school that best meets their needs and enables them to reach their academic goals. To find out more please click here for more information!

a.title: Go to comments for Family Empowerment Scholarship Available!

div.p: Join us for Drive Thru Kindergarten & VPK registration on Thursday, May 7th. Registration will begin at 9am and will end at 3pm. Registration will take place at all Elementary Schools and The Rainbow Center.

a.title: Go to comments for Drive Thru Registration!!

div.p: Report Card 3 is now available for all students and parents via the Focus portal. The report cards are also available for download and print options. If for any reason you need a printed copy of your child's report card and are unable to print a copy, please contact your child's school for further assistance. Thank you.

a.title: Go to comments for Report Card 3 Now Available!

img.alt: How is the US Census data used?

a.span: How is the US Census data used?

div.p: Discover how completing your Census form will benefit your county and schools. Click the title above for more information!

a.title: Go to comments for How is the US Census data used?

div.p: Breakfast and lunch will only be provided Mondays and Thursdays starting the week of April 6. Each child will receive 3 days of meals on the distribution days of Mondays and Thursdays. This new method of distribution will continue until the emergency has been lifted, currently May 1, 2020. Meals will be offered curbside/drive thru only on Monday and Thursday between the hours of 9:30am-11:30am at Bradford High School, Brooker Elementary, Hampton Elementary, Lawtey Elementary and Southside Elementary Schools. Additionally, Concerned Citizens of Bradford County located at 1080 Pine Street will also receive meals from 9:00am-11:00am.

a.title: Go to comments for Student Meals During Closings

div.p: ALL Round Ups for BES, HES, LES, SES, SSE have been postponed. NEW dates will be forthcoming after we return to school.

a.title: Go to comments for ALL Round Ups Postponed

img.alt: Florida Leads the Nation in AP Exam Participation!

a.span: Florida Leads the Nation in AP Exam Participation!

div.p: The College Board announced that Florida leads the nation with the highest percentage of the class of 2019 graduates who took an Advanced Placement (AP) exam while in high school.

a.title: Go to comments for Florida Leads the Nation in AP Exam Participation!

img.alt: Bradford Middle School Boys Win Championship!

a.span: Bradford Middle School Boys Win Championship!

div.p: Bradford County boys basketball team wins the 2019/20 NEFAC Conference Championship! This is BMS’s first basketball conference championship in boys basketball since 2015!

a.title: Go to comments for Bradford Middle School Boys Win Championship!

img.alt: Bradford County Agricultural Students Present Bills to Lawmakers in Strong Fashion

a.span: Bradford County Agricultural Students Present Bills to Lawmakers in Strong Fashion

div.p: The Bradford County Agriculture students were able to present two Senate Bills and two House Bills to lawmakers, while also conveying the impact that FFA and Agriculture education is having in their lives.

a.title: Go to comments for Bradford County Agricultural Students Present Bills to Lawmakers in Strong Fashion

div.p: Did you know that VyStar is going to be opening a bank right here on the BHS campus? We’ll start construction soon, opening in the Fall. We’re looking for students NOW that are interested in having a paid summer internship and then starting a career path next fall! See any BHS administrator for more details!

a.title: Go to comments for VyStar Branch Comes to BHS!

img.alt: Bradford County Education Foundation Receives a $2000 STEM Grant for Engineering!

a.span: Bradford County Education Foundation Receives a $2000 STEM Grant for Engineering!

div.p: The Bradford County Education Foundation received a STEM grant for Engineering. The grant of $2,000 was awarded to Doug Samons for the District's elementary gifted program. Pictured in the photo are BCEF members Cheryl Canova, Stacey Creighton, Lila Sellars, Eugenia Whitehead, and recipient Doug Samons.

a.title: Go to comments for Bradford County Education Foundation Receives a $2000 STEM Grant for Engineering!

div.p: The 2019-2020 School Calendar is available. Make sure to mark your personal calendars of the holidays, teacher planning days, and early dismissal dates!

a.title: Go to comments for 2019-2020 School Calendar

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
